title: How accurate is it to say 'true questions only happen between the known and unknown'? Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: Truth has to important distinction logic and honesty Your question is about the logical aspect. In the sense that you ask the question; propositions about those things which can have a true or false value like “known and unknown” can only be identified as true or false So the answer is “Yes.”
That seems an accurate saying. If I don’t know, I ask. If I know but still ask, then it’s not a true question; I’ve asked for some other reason.
